level.heading: ORDER OF BUSINESS FOR REGULAR MEETINGS (§ 7-1514)

level.text: The Board shall be called to order at the time and place designated pursuant to § 1509.
The Chairman shall ascertain the presence of a quorum before any business is transacted.
The Board shall take up business, after a quorum is ascertained, in the following order:
Approval of the minutes of the previous meeting;
Approval of the Consent Agenda without objection by another member;

Final vote on rules that have been pending at least thirty (30) days since the publication of Notice of Proposed, Final, and/or Emergency Rulemaking in the District of Columbia Register pursuant to D.C. Code §2-205(a) (2001);
Official communications received from other governmental agencies;
Other business previously placed on the agenda; and
Other business not previously placed on the agenda.

Items listed in §1514.3 which require Board action or approval cannot be acted upon in the absence of a quorum. The Board may, at the beginning of a meeting, set a different order for a particular meeting, in which case the order set by the Board shall be followed for that meeting, subject to the provisions of §1516.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 49 DCR 10803, 10804 (November 29, 2002).
